holidays.name: Christmas Day 🎄
holidays.description: Celebration of the birth of Jesus Christ, widely observed by billions around the world with gift-giving, festive meals, and decorations.
holidays.origin: Christian religious holiday with origins dating back to early Christianity, officially adopted on December 25 in the 4th century.
holidays.funFact: The tradition of Christmas trees originated in 16th-century Germany and was popularized in the English-speaking world by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert.

holidays.name: National Pumpkin Pie Day 🥧
holidays.description: A day to enjoy and celebrate the delicious, spicy-sweet pumpkin pie, a staple dessert especially popular during the holiday season in the United States.
holidays.origin: Named to honor the seasonal and iconic American dessert, often enjoyed on holidays like Thanksgiving and Christmas.
holidays.funFact: The earliest pumpkin pies didn’t have a crust! Early American settlers simply baked the spiced pumpkin filling in a pie dish.

holidays.name: National Candy Cane Day 🍬
holidays.description: A day devoted to the red-and-white striped candy sticks that are a symbol of Christmas festivities and decorations around the world.
holidays.origin: Candy canes originated in 17th-century Europe, with the classic shape allegedly invented around 1670 to resemble a shepherd’s crook.
holidays.funFact: The original candy canes were all white; the red stripes were added in the early 20th century to symbolize the blood of Christ.

holidays.name: National Thank You Note Day 💌
holidays.description: A quirky holiday encouraging people to write and send thank-you notes, spreading gratitude during the busy holiday season.
holidays.origin: Created to promote the thoughtful tradition of handwriting thank-you notes during Christmas and holiday gift exchanges.
holidays.funFact: The tradition of sending thank-you notes dates back hundreds of years, but this day gives a little extra nudge to keep the custom alive in the digital age.

holidays.name: Oxford Dictionary Day 📚
holidays.description: Celebrates the day the Oxford English Dictionary was first published, honoring the compilation of the English language’s vast and quirky vocabulary.
holidays.origin: First volume of the Oxford English Dictionary was published on December 25, 1884.
holidays.funFact: The original OED took 70 years to complete and involved thousands of volunteer readers hunting down word usages in books.
